admreg: Middle East and North Africa,Middle East and North Africa

abstracts.cdata!:
The objective of the project is to
            provide shelter, employment and urban services for the
            lowest income groups at costs they can afford, thus
            eliminating the need for direct public subsidies and
            permitting the project to be replicated on a larger scale.
            The project is expected to improve living conditions and
            increase employment opportunities for an immediate design
            population of about 120,000 low income persons in Cairo,
            Alexandria, and Assiut and will be primarily executed by
            these three Governorates assisted by a central government
            unit. The project would include six closely related
            components: (i) comprehensive upgrading of four settlements;
            (ii) sites and services on two sites; (iii) a small business
            assistance and manpower training program; (iv) improvement
            in solid waste collection and disposal; (v) urgent repairs
            to water supply and sewerage systems; and (vi) technical
            assistance in project implementation and institution building.
